intro: Thibaudia mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican thibaudia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Thibaudia mexicana is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
